Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_n0t37esfcP1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/ARIkoiqf1gQ" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p>helldiver’s <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/68429-0-23-Kerbin-Shuttle-Orbiter-System-v1-11-aka-Kerbin-Mini-Shuttle"><strong>Kerbal Shuttle Orbiter System</strong></a>, otherwise known as <strong>Kerbin Mini Shuttle</strong> takes the best of NASA, Buran and Kliper orbiter vehicles and put a <strong>Kerbal</strong> twist on it in this recent and highly popular mod. </p>

<p>The mod is superbly put together and includes: The orbiter, engines, a lift vehicle, docking modules, emissive lights, centerline rear end shroud fairing and a decoupler ring. Not to mention detailed instructions on how to use components of the mo in-game, as well as a roadmap for what’s to come in phase II. This is all very meticulous and goes to great lengths to ensure that it integrates well with the <em><strong>KSP</strong></em> experience. The entire team is to be commended.</p>

<p>Find out more about <strong>Kerbin Shuttle Orbiter System</strong> <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/68429-0-23-Kerbin-Shuttle-Orbiter-System-v1-11-aka-Kerbin-Mini-Shuttle"><strong>HERE</strong></a>.</p>

Isn't the music in the video from SimCity?

It is. Great game... until EA said they wanted to add in "crack protection".

Overall, I love it. It looks gorgeous, handles well and is really intuitive. I especially love the HUD in the shuttle (though the ability to change it to an ILS would be nice but the might not be possible) and it's overall a neat mod.

But...

Looking at the assembly, It looks like a model plane kit where everything has to be exact or it won't work right as opposed to open assembly akin to LEGO or MECCANO that KSP is known for.

Like I said, it's a fantastic mod, but kind of limiting.
